message: (around half of the runners are spot instances at any one time, which basically halves costs)
I don't think I've seen anything posted on what motivated the move and I think it would be instructive and help inform future decision making on cloud hosting.
So, firstly, it was Linode we were on, not RSC :)

Secondly, we crunched the numbers, and EC2 really comes out a lot better for memory and CPU time, and they're not too far off on bandwidth - especially with spot pricing, which we can use since we have a redundant system
EC2 instances aren't persistent. And Rackspace is cheaper, so why not RSC?
Rackspace isn't cheaper for what we're doing. Trust me, I have a breakdown of cost per CPU hour/GB of RAM/GB of BW/etc.
Remember, we don't need persistance at all - ep.io is written correctly for a cloud service - and so we can leverage the good parts of EC2
